Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix

Class QRDecomposition

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix.QRDecomposition
All Implemented Interfaces:
MatrixSolver
public class QRDecomposition extends Object implements MatrixSolver
QR Decomposition.

For an m-by-n matrix A with m >= n, the QR decomposition is an m-by-n orthogonal matrix Q and an n-by-n upper triangular matrix R so that A = Q*R.

The QR decomposition always exists, even if the matrix does not have full rank, so the constructor will never fail. The primary use of the QR decomposition is in the least squares solution of non-square systems of simultaneous linear equations. This will fail if isFullRank() returns false.

    • solveTranspose

      public void solveTranspose()
      Factorizes using the transpose of the input matrix which allows direct access instead of pointer resolved access to the matrix. This mathod can be much much faster than the standard method if the matrix order is larger than about 20 or 30.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Returns true if the decomposition is valid for solving a system of linear equations.
      Specified by:
      isValid in interface MatrixSolver

    • isFullRank

      public boolean isFullRank()
      Is the matrix full rank?
      Returns:
      True if R, and hence A, has full rank.

    • getH

      public Matrix getH()
      Return the Householder vectors
      Returns:

    • solve

      public Matrix solve​(Matrix B)
      Least squares solution of A*X = B
      Parameters:
      B - A Matrix with as many rows as A and any number of columns.
      Returns:
      Solution Matrix X that minimizes the two norm of Q*R*X-B.

    • solve

      public void solve​(double[][] a, double[][] b)
      Solve A*a = b
      Specified by:
      solve in interface MatrixSolver
      Parameters:
      a - The solution matrix with as many or more rows than A and at least 1 column that will contain the solution on exit. Note that a will be resized to the size of b on exit but only the first n rows contain the solution.
      b - The RHS Matrix with as many or more rows than A and at least 1 column.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Matrix row dimensions must equal or exceed m.

    • solve

      public void solve​(double[][] a)
      Solve A*a = b
      Specified by:
      solve in interface MatrixSolver
      Parameters:
      a - The solution matrix with as many or more rows than A and at least 1 column that will contain the RHS on entry and the solution on exit. Note the solution only overwrites the first n rows of a if m > n.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Matrix row dimensions must equal or exceed m.
      RuntimeException - Matrix is not full rank.
